definitions.example: Our program for today’s exercise class includes swimming and jogging.

definitions.definition: A leaflet listing information about a play, game or other activity.
definitions.example: The program consisted of ads for restaurants and the credits of everyone connected with the play.

definitions.definition: A performance of a show or other broadcast on radio or television.
definitions.example: Tonight’s program was hosted by Johnny Carson.

definitions.definition: A software application, or a collection of software applications, designed to perform a specific task.
definitions.example: The program runs on both Linux and Microsoft Windows.

definitions.definition: (especially in the phrase "get with the program") A particular mindset or method of doing things.
To enter a program or other instructions into (a computer or other electronic device) to instruct it to do a particular task.
definitions.example: He programmed the DVR to record his favorite show.

definitions.definition: To develop (software) by writing program code.
definitions.example: I programmed a small game as a demonstration.

definitions.definition: To put together the schedule of an event.
To cause to automatically behave in a particular way.
definitions.example: The lab rat was programmed to press the lever when the bell rang.
